Quickstart¶

This page should give you all the information needed to create something in blender very quickly

  1. First you need to download and install Blender. This can be done from https://www.blender.org/download/

  2. Next copy the files from Blogo/src/ into <blender_install_dir>/scripts/ (there are two directories in /src/ which should both already exist in scripts, the contents should be merged in)

  3. Then run Blender, choose “New File/General” and you should see a cube floating in the middle of a pair of axes.

  4. Hit Shift+F4 on your keyboard to take you to the python console. (There is a scripting section which will let you edit code in Blender, I prefer to edit code outside Blender)

  5. Create a file somewhere which contains

    from blogo import *
from blogo_utils import *

BlogoUtils.start_fresh()
BlogoUtils.add_light_area()

turtle = Blogo()
turtle.set_texture("yellow")
for i in range(10):
    turtle.circle(6)
    turtle.rt(36)

    Let’s assume this file is called “c:/dev/first.py”

  6. Back in the Blender python console type

    show("c:/dev/first.py")

    and press ENTER.

  7. After a short pause you should see a pretty yellow flower. You can click on the X/Y/Z in the top right corner of the view to rotate round it and use the magnifying glass to zoom in or out, the hand to pan around it.

  8. Now either play around with the files in examples/ or adding some more code to first.py
